Description of incident: Laptop computers with birth dates              and other personal information of roughly 321,000 blood donors are              missing and presumed stolen. Stored inside both computers were names,              birth dates and addresses at the time of the individual's last donation              or attempted donation. In most cases, the donors' Social Security              numbers were also stored, along with driver's licenses, telephone              numbers, e-mail addresses, ethnicity, marital status, blood type and              cholesterol levels. Social Security numbers had been used to track              blood from the donor to the recipients.
